text: When I notice limits or boundaries, I recognize them and choose to understand whether they're real or inherited.
During moments when I feel constrained, I notice it and choose to explore what's possible beyond those limits.
When I feel the pull to stay within familiar boundaries, I notice it and choose to push beyond them instead.
I let not being able to push limits or break boundaries prevent me from expanding beyond inherited constraints.
When I notice inherited limits shaping my thinking, I recognize them and choose to rewrite them with awareness.
I see when boundaries are mental cages rather than real limits, and I choose to step beyond them.
When I feel the urge to accept limits without question, I notice it and choose to challenge them instead.
I let problems from not bending boundaries prevent me from identifying and pushing beyond inherited limits.
When I notice myself operating within old boundaries, I recognize it and choose to expand my perspective instead.
I recognize when limits come from fear or tradition rather than reality, and I choose to move beyond them.
When I feel the pull to stay small and safe, I notice it and choose to think globally and expand instead.
I let not being able to push limits prevent me from maintaining boundary bending abilities and expanding.
When I notice boundary bending happening, I recognize it and choose to strengthen those patterns.
I see when I need to push beyond inherited limits, and I choose to do so with awareness and intention.
When I feel the urge to let old boundaries control me, I notice it and choose to rewrite them instead.
I let not identifying boundary bending abilities prevent me from pushing limits and breaking inherited constraints.
When I notice myself thinking beyond boundaries, I recognize it and choose to maintain that expanded mindset.
I recognize when limits are self-imposed, and I choose to remove them and expand my possibilities.
When I feel the pull to accept inherited boundaries, I notice it and choose to challenge and expand them instead.
I let not being able to bend boundaries prevent me from identifying and pushing beyond inherited limits effectively.
